Posts.Content: Hello Karen I know what you mean about having a bra that is easy to open.  I shall take note and Wear my front fastening bra when I begin radiotherapy.  It's whatever you are comfortable with at the end of the day.  I don't think I will return to underwire bras again.   Well I am 51 but it does make you feel better when you feel sexyou and attractive, even if you are not going to have anything on display.  What is a control mammogram?  It's all so new and can be scary.  I try to be brave and not think of the C word, just refer to it as a lump needing to be removed.  I have histology next Friday and I am anoxious about that.  Hoping as we all would be that all was removed with good clearance and that sentinel lymph nodes are clear.   Good luck with your mammogram and let me know how things go for you. Best wishes - love Lorraine xx
Posts.Title: scared to put a bra on after surger for lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Well that was a success.  I probably tried it on too soon after surgery.  I have always preferred being bra less though.   Should make myself look decent as I am going to my grandsons harvest festival this afternoon.   I am very surprised with my range of movement and was expecting to be a lot stiffer and more sore when doing the exercises.  Think the boredom will be my worst bug bear.

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy on Wednesday 5th October and before the surgery I bouget myself three new non wired bras.  One is by Royce and has silver in the lining which helps with healing.  I tried ton put the bra on just after the surgery when I was getting dressed to go home and as it pressed against by breast I decided not to wear it and go bra less.   I am very comfortable bra less but wondered if others were the same and how long after surgery should I wait before trying to wear a bra again?  I have larger breasts 36E, if that makes any difference,  I don't know.
